text.text_translated: Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, we see signs of the first groups of people. For example, we see paintings inside big holes in mountains. Nobody knows how these paintings and language go together. People's brains did not get bigger quickly. But people started to do more difficult things and they became smarter. Did using language make their brains better? Or did their better brains start to make language?
